alert.note: Alert for Grand Canyon Country; Kaibab Plateau (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 28 at 3:00AM MST until December 28 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON ABOVE 4500 FEET... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow above 4500 feet. Periods of snow continue through the day today. Total snow accumulations generally ranging from 2 to 5 inches, with lesser amounts below 5000 feet and locally higher amounts above 7000 feet. Southwest winds gusting to near 40 mph at times, leading to areas of blowing snow. * WHERE...Kaibab Plateau and the Grand Canyon above 4500 feet. Including Fredonia, Grand Canyon, Jacob Lake and the North Rim. * WHEN...Until 5 PM MST this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Slippery and snow covered roads could led to very difficult travel. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility at times. Additional snow forecast through 5 PM this afternoon: Fredonia 0 to 1 inches Grand Canyon 2 to 4 inches Jacob Lake 1 to 3 inches North Rim 3 to 5 inches.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
